snippet: The Obama administration is rightly pressing colleges to bring clarity to the often misleading and unintelligible financial aid letters to newly admitted students.
abstract: Editorial praises the Obama administration for pressing colleges to bring clarity to the often misleading and unintelligible financial aid letters that many send out to newly accepted students; argues that plan to standardize and simplify such letters is a good start, but that more must be done to allow students and their families to easily compare school costs.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is rightly pressing colleges to bring clarity to the often misleading and unintelligible financial aid letters to newly admitted students.
